00138 #define arg_ACCESS4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opaccess
00139 #define res_ACCESS4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opaccess
00140 
00141 int nfs4_op_access(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00142                      compound_data_t   * data,
00143                      struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00144 {
00145   fsal_accessflags_t     access_mode ;
00146   cache_inode_status_t   cache_status ;
00147   uint32_t               max_access = (ACCESS4_READ|ACCESS4_LOOKUP|ACCESS4_MODIFY|ACCESS4_EXTEND|ACCESS4_DELETE|ACCESS4_EXECUTE) ;
00148   char            funcname[] = "nfs4_op_access" ;
00149   
00150 
00151   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_ACCESS ;
00152   res_ACCESS4.status =  NFS4_OK  ;
00153   
00154   /* All access types are supported */
00155   res_ACCESS4.ACCESS4res_u.resok4.supported = arg_ACCESS4.access ;
00156   
00157   /* If there is no FH */
00158   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->currentFH  ) ) )
00159     {
00160       res_ACCESS4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00161       return res_ACCESS4.status ;
00162     }
00163   
00164   /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00165   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->currentFH ) ) )
00166     {
00167       res_ACCESS4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00168       return res_ACCESS4.status ;
00169     }
00170     
00171   /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00172   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00173     {
00174       res_ACCESS4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00175       return res_ACCESS4.status ;
00176     }
00177   
00178   /* If Filehandle points to a pseudo fs entry, manage it via pseudofs specific functions */
00179   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Pseudo( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00180     return nfs4_op_access_pseudo( op, data, resp ) ;
00181 
00182   /* Check for input parameter's sanity */
00183   if( arg_ACCESS4.access > max_access )
00184     {
00185       res_ACCESS4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00186       return res_ACCESS4.status ;
00187     }
00188 
00189  
00190   /* Parse the incoming argument to get the access bits */
00191   access_mode = 0 ;  
00192   
00193   if( arg_ACCESS4.access & ACCESS4_READ )
00194     access_mode      |= FSAL_R_OK ;
00195   
00196     
00197   if( arg_ACCESS4.access & ACCESS4_LOOKUP )
00198     access_mode       |= FSAL_X_OK ;
00199   
00200   if( arg_ACCESS4.access & (ACCESS4_MODIFY |ACCESS4_EXTEND  ) )
00201     access_mode       |= FSAL_W_OK ;
00202   
00203   if( arg_ACCESS4.access & ACCESS4_DELETE )
00204     access_mode       |= FSAL_W_OK ;
00205   
00206   if( arg_ACCESS4.access & ACCESS4_EXECUTE )
00207     access_mode       |= FSAL_X_OK ;
00208   
00209   if( cache_inode_access( data->current_entry,
00210                           access_mode, 
00211                           data->ht,
00212                           data->pclient,
00213                           data->pcontext,
00214                           &cache_status ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00215     {
00216       /* In Unix semantic (like HPSS NameSpace), delete and lookup permission only applies to directories */
00217       if( data->current_filetype == DIR_BEGINNING || data->current_filetype == DIR_CONTINUE )
00218         {
00219           /* access type ACCES4_EXECUTE is meaningless for directories */
00220           res_ACCESS4.ACCESS4res_u.resok4.supported = (ACCESS4_READ|ACCESS4_LOOKUP|ACCESS4_DELETE|ACCESS4_MODIFY|ACCESS4_EXTEND) & arg_ACCESS4.access ;
00221           res_ACCESS4.ACCESS4res_u.resok4.access = ( arg_ACCESS4.access & ~ACCESS4_EXECUTE ) ;
00222         }
00223       else 
00224         {
00225           /* access types ACCES4_LOOKUP and ACCCES4_DELETE are meaningless for directories */
00226           res_ACCESS4.ACCESS4res_u.resok4.supported = (ACCESS4_READ|ACCESS4_MODIFY|ACCESS4_EXTEND|ACCESS4_EXECUTE) & arg_ACCESS4.access ;
00227           res_ACCESS4.ACCESS4res_u.resok4.access = ( ( arg_ACCESS4.access & ~ACCESS4_DELETE ) & ~ACCESS4_LOOKUP ) ;
00228         } 
00229 
00230       res_ACCESS4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00231       return res_ACCESS4.status ;
00232     }
00233   
00234   /* If you reach this point, then an error occured */
00235   
00236   res_ACCESS4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00237   
00238   return res_ACCESS4.status;
00239 } /* nfs4_op_access */
00240 
00241 
00252 void nfs4_op_access_Free( ACCESS4res * resp )
00253 {
00254   /* Nothing to be done */
00255   return ;
00256 } /* nfs4_op_access_Free */
